abstract: Shanel Nadal and Nephra Payne plead guilty to second-degree custodial interference after taking their eight children from foster care agency in Queens to Pennsylvania; judge indicates that they will be sentenced to 90 days in jail and three years' probation.
snippet: Shanel Nadal and Nephra Payne pleaded guilty to second-degree custodial interference after taking their children from foster care in Queens to Pennsylvania.
lead_paragraph: Shanel Nadal and Nephra Payne pleaded guilty to second-degree custodial interference after taking their children from foster care in Queens to Pennsylvania.

headline.main: Couple Who Took 8 Children From Foster Care Face Jail
headline.print_headline: Couple Who Took 8 Children From Foster Care Face Jail Term
headline.seo: Couple Plead Guilty to Taking 8 Children From Foster Care
